page.title: 10Traffic Dangers in Bletchley
page.content: In Bletchley childrens'main way of getting around is by cycling.We talked to some of the children in our school about the problems of cycle riding and found that the main dangers were these. Not maintaining their bikes properly eg.on one of our bike rides on the Domesday Survey one bike lost a brake block before we started,its chain came off 3 times off on the journey and also the back wheel started to rub on the frame so it had to be reset. Riding bikes without lights in the dark. Riding in groups. On the cycle paths there are blind corners so you come up to people very quickly. Cars and lorries driving too close. Car doors opening when being overtaken
